mcqs.question: Which of the following is a basic rule when naming a file to be used as an HTML document?
options: File names should not contain spaces
File names must always be uppercase
File names can only contain numbers
mcqs.explanation: HTML file names should avoid spaces and special characters; use hyphens or underscores if necessary.

mcqs.question: What is the standard file extension for an HTML file?
mcqs.explanation: The standard file extension for HTML files is `.html`.

mcqs.question: Which of the following file names is valid for an HTML document?
mcqs.explanation: `my-page.html` is a valid file name because it contains no spaces or special characters.

mcqs.question: Which file extension will NOT be recognized as an HTML file by most browsers?
mcqs.explanation: `.txt` is not an HTML file extension and will not be rendered as HTML by browsers.

mcqs.question: What is the best practice for naming HTML files for websites?
mcqs.explanation: Lowercase letters and hyphens are best for compatibility and readability.

mcqs.question: What is the recommended name for the main HTML file of a website?
mcqs.explanation: `index.html` is the conventional default file that most web servers look for.

mcqs.question: If you name your file `index.htm`, will it work the same as `index.html`?
options: Only if you add a DOCTYPE
mcqs.explanation: Most web servers support both `.html` and `.htm` as valid HTML extensions.

mcqs.question: Which of the following file names is NOT recommended for web deployment?
mcqs.explanation: File names with spaces (`contact us.html`) can cause issues and should be avoided.

mcqs.question: Are HTML file names case sensitive on all servers?
mcqs.explanation: Unix/Linux servers are case sensitive; Windows servers are not.

mcqs.question: What should you avoid when naming HTML files?
mcqs.explanation: Avoid spaces and special characters for maximum compatibility.

mcqs.question: Why is it recommended to use `.html` instead of `.htm` for new projects?
options: `.htm` does not work in modern browsers
mcqs.explanation: `.html` is more descriptive and is the modern standard extension.

mcqs.question: Which is a valid file name for an HTML file?
mcqs.explanation: `my-page.html` is valid; avoid spaces and special characters.

mcqs.question: What happens if you use an unsupported file extension for an HTML file?
options: The browser will still render it as HTML
The browser will display the raw code as plain text
It will not open at all
It will cause a syntax error
mcqs.explanation: Browsers will display raw code if the extension is not recognized as HTML.

mcqs.question: Which of the following file names will most likely cause issues?
mcqs.explanation: Avoid special characters like `@` in file names.

mcqs.question: What is the maximum recommended length for an HTML file name?
options: There is no strict maximum, but shorter is better for usability
mcqs.explanation: Shorter file names are better for compatibility and usability.

mcqs.question: What character is often used to separate words in HTML file names?
mcqs.explanation: Hyphens are recommended for separating words.

mcqs.question: If you want your HTML file to be the homepage, what should you name it?
mcqs.explanation: `index.html` is the standard homepage file name on most web servers.

mcqs.question: Which extension is NOT valid for an HTML file?
mcqs.explanation: .css is for stylesheets, not HTML files.

mcqs.question: Why should you avoid uppercase letters in file names?
options: Uppercase is not allowed by HTML
To avoid case sensitivity issues on different servers
mcqs.explanation: Use lowercase to avoid case sensitivity issues, especially on Unix/Linux.

mcqs.question: Which filename is best practice for an About page HTML file?
mcqs.explanation: about-us.html uses lowercase and hyphens, which is best practice.
